alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:57PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...CAUTION REGARDING HIGH WATER ON THE MENDENHALL RIVER... Heavy rain over the past 48 hours alongside periodic rain showers through the day has caused the Mendenhall River to rise to bankful conditions, with the water level continuing to slowly rise. Some debris from falling trees has been reported moving down river. Use caution when rafting down the river. As of late afternoon, the rate of rise is starting to slow and a crest just below minor flood stage is likely late this evening. Therefore, no significant flooding is expected, but we will update should conditions change. For Mendenhall Lake: At 4:15 pm the stage was 8.58 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 8.9 feet is expected around 11pm this Sunday night.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
